item.title: Report E-2024120163
item.description:
Report E-2024120163

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading pallet onto trailer a box on top fell off the pallet hitting the floor causing an inner container to rupture consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the ruptured can.

item.title: Report X-2024120431
item.description:
Report X-2024120431

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF states that a dock worker was unloading trailer 500400 in dock door 213 when they found a 55LB bag of UN3126, SELF-HEATING SOLID, CORROSIVE, ORGANIC, N.O.S. (2-HYDROXYBIPHENOL, SODIUM SALT), 4.2 (8), PG II that had spilled about 1 cup onto the trailer floor. ABF Supervisor states that he's not s ure exactly what caused it but it looks like it got damaged during transit by another piece of freight rubbing against it. ABF Safety contacted CURA and they're dispatching a cleaning crew to the terminal on emergency response. ABF advised Supervisor to send photos to Safety.
